Posts.Content: The path report just says PT2 no lower case letters
Posts.Signature: PSA 4.8 07/25/2010 PSA 6.2 10/08/2010 PSA 4.4 12/29/2010 PSA 4.7 01/31/2012 PSA 5.4 07/02/2018 18 Core Biopsy 9/12/2018 2 out of 18 cores positive -PROSTATE, RIGHT APEX, NEEDLE CORE BIOPSY: PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON SCORE 3+3=6 (GRADE GROUP 1), INVOLVING 1 OF 3 CORES (10%) -PROSTATE, LEFT MID, NEEDLE CORE BIOPSY: PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON SCORE 3+4=7 (GRADE GROUP 2, 40% PATTERN 4) INVOLVING 1 OF 5 CORES (20%) Post-op Path Gleason 3+4 30% pattern 4 grade group 2 confined to prostate no evidence of lymphovascular space invasion, no EPE, no seminal vesicle involvement all margins negative bladder neck negative for tumor % of prostate involved 25% pT2,pNO weight 57grams 3 month post-op PSA <.01
Posts.Title: Prostate has been removed, biochemical reoccurrence metrics calculators

Posts.Content: Hello All - Now that I have had my prostate removed and I am recovering. I would like to research the 3 month PSA post RALP, metrics and or determine my risk profile for Biochem return, elevated PSA metrics and plan accordingly. There is a myriad of calculators and stats, but they vary greatly, any isight would be great.
Posts.Signature: PSA 4.8 07/25/2010 PSA 6.2 10/08/2010 PSA 4.4 12/29/2010 PSA 4.7 01/31/2012 PSA 5.4 07/02/2018 18 Core Biopsy 9/12/2018 2 out of 18 cores positive -PROSTATE, RIGHT APEX, NEEDLE CORE BIOPSY: PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON SCORE 3+3=6 (GRADE GROUP 1), INVOLVING 1 OF 3 CORES (10%) -PROSTATE, LEFT MID, NEEDLE CORE BIOPSY: PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON SCORE 3+4=7 (GRADE GROUP 2, 40% PATTERN 4) INVOLVING 1 OF 5 CORES (20%) Post-op Path Gleason 3+4 30% pattern 4 grade group 2 confined to prostate no evidence of lymphovascular space invasion, no EPE, no seminal vesicle involvement all margins negative bladder neck negative for tumor % of prostate involved 25% pT2,pNO weight 57grams 3 month post-op PSA <.01
Posts.Title: Prostate has been removed, biochemical reoccurrence metrics calculators

Posts.Content: After further review of the path results and looking at prostate and lesion measurements not sure I agree with the % prostate involvement prostate size = 5x4.5x4.4cm = 99cm3 lesion size = .8x.4x.4cm = .13cm3 this definitely does not calculate to 25% prostate involvement - what are your thoughts? given the prostate shape irregularity and using a crude volume formula BxHxW

Posts.Content: Hey all - Good news cath is out, but dribbling like crazy, don't know when I have to go, or have urgency yet. Definitely not continent yet as of the second day. What was your experience the first 3-4 days post cath? So I can gauge my expectations. I am already doing kegels. ED is already good. All post-op path is clear.

Posts.Title: 3 month post-op PSA

Posts.Content: Self pity is complicated for sure. I would say I am somewhere in the middle.
Posts.Title: Self-Pity 101

Posts.Content: I had my RALP on Monday. I was discharged on Tuesday. Points of interest: No narcotics since Monday night for pain just Tylenol The most challenging part for me is the catheter: I recommend the leg bag makes it easier, however it is difficult to empty so my wife does it. (Taking a poop with a catheter is a challenge I am worried because when I sit down on the toilet I get residual urine leaking and blood seepage around the catheter and I don't want to do damage. No success pooping yet, any advice would be great.) Walking around is easy. I am still a little bloated in the belly, and my urine is slightly rose colored.

Posts.Content: here is what I know 53 y/o Stage of cancer T1c PSA 5.4 2 cores positive Gleason 3+3 1st one Gleason 3+4 2nd one
Posts.Title: please welcome me to the club

Posts.Content: Unsure if I would consider AS, as I would prefer to just take charge and get it done. But doing a ton of research. Would be great to get an opinion om my PATH results..

Posts.Title: Meeting with the URO next Friday for TX options

Posts.Content: Doc was cool - no-pressure type of meeting. I listened to what he had to say. I did a ton research myself, crunched the numbers back and forth 10X times. my two (IMO) best options for me BT or RALP - the outcomes, prognosis are fairly even given my BX's I am still actively researching and no final decision made. take it out or radiate.. from your experiences what do you think?

Posts.Content: thank you. agree lots of info here..

Posts.Content: thank you. agree lots of info here..

Posts.Content: Apparently a nursing strike is underway, and all elective surgery at the facility is postponed. I am bummed to say the least

Posts.Title: RALP postponed while driving to hospital

Posts.Content: Thanks guys for the great feedback. I switched to the big catheter bag 2000cc. I never realized how much urine we make in a day. Pain is still controlled with Tylenol. I did lots of walking which is very helpful. All in all a good day for my 2nd day postop. More updates later.

Points of interest: No narcotics since Monday night for pain just Tylenol The most challenging part for me is the catheter: I recommend the leg bag makes it easier, however it is difficult to empty so my wife does it. (Taking a poop with a catheter is a challenge I am worried because when I sit down on the toilet I get residual urine leaking and blood seepage around the catheter and I don't want to do damage. No success pooping yet, any advice would be great.) Walking around is easy. I am still a little bloated in the belly, and my urine is slightly rose colored.

Posts.Content: Doc was cool - no-pressure type of meeting. I listened to what he had to say. I did a ton research myself, crunched the numbers back and forth 10X times. my two (IMO) best options for me BT or RALP - the outcomes, prognosis are fairly even given my BX's I am still actively researching and no final decision made. take it out or radiate.. from your experiences what do you think?
Posts.Signature: PSA 4.8 07/25/2010 PSA 6.2 10/08/2010 PSA 4.4 12/29/2010 PSA 4.7 01/31/2012 PSA 5.4 07/02/2018 18 Core Biopsy 9/12/2018 2 out of 18 cores positive -PROSTATE, RIGHT APEX, NEEDLE CORE BIOPSY: PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON SCORE 3+3=6 (GRADE GROUP 1), INVOLVING 1 OF 3 CORES (10%) -PROSTATE, LEFT MID, NEEDLE CORE BIOPSY: PROSTATIC ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON SCORE 3+4=7 (GRADE GROUP 2, 40% PATTERN 4) INVOLVING 1 OF 5 CORES (20%) Post-op Path Gleason 3+4 30% pattern 4 grade group 2 confined to prostate no evidence of lymphovascular space invasion, no EPE, no seminal vesicle involvement all margins negative bladder neck negative for tumor % of prostate involved 25% pT2,pNO weight 57grams 3 month post-op PSA <.01
Posts.Title: Meeting with the URO next Friday for TX options

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Pratoman So it looks like you had 2 positive cores. They only took 8 cores? They took 18 cores, of 18 cores 2 were positive

Posts.Title: Meeting with the URO next Friday for TX options

Posts.Content: here is what I know 53 y/o Stage of cancer T1c PSA 5.4 2 cores positive Gleason 3+3 1st one Gleason 3+4 2nd one
Posts.Title: please welcome me to the club

Posts.Content: Unsure if I would consider AS, as I would prefer to just take charge and get it done. But doing a ton of research. Would be great to get an opinion om my PATH results..

Posts.Title: Meeting with the URO next Friday for TX options

Posts.Content: Progressing good Only Tylenol for pain - my pain can be described as to many situps pain also my perinium area is a bit achy and the trochar site that had the JP drain is sore. How long did it take for all of your JP drain sites to heal up and stop oozing? I am getting a dime sized spot of blood / serous sanguinous discharge. Activity level is good except for carrying the urine bag around and explaining to all the neighbors whatÂs going on. ItÂs interesting because every wife is challenging there husband for the result of there last PSA test or if theyÂve been tested. I can feel the urinary urethra/sphincter in my bladder contracting around the catheter doc said that is good everything is waking up. Also never realized how great a hot shower is. Catheter out this Thursday. Also did an on-site hospital Q/A last night for some guys in the treatment pipeline over 20 guys with their wives and kids showed up. DidnÂt realize how big our community is. I must have answered a 100 questions and also recommended this site. More to come.
